intro: Stoebe aethiopica, commonly known as Ethiopian sainfoin, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region and parts of southern Europe. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are pinnately compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets with serrated edges. Stoebe aethiopica is adapted to dry, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
